thread.title: 84 Lumber releases rejected ending to Super Bowl commercial
thread.title_full: 84 Lumber releases rejected ending to Super Bowl commercial

author: Houston Chronicle Sports
title: 84 Lumber releases rejected ending to Super Bowl commercial
text:
Close Image 1 of 1 
Images of a border wall in 84 Lumber's Super Bowl commercial were deemed too controversial by Fox. 
Images of a border wall in 84 Lumber's Super Bowl commercial were deemed too controversial by Fox. Photo: 84 Lumber 84 Lumber releases rejected ending to Super Bowl commercial 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 
The ending to 84 Lumber's premier Super Bowl commercial was originally rejected by Fox because it was "too controversial to air during the Super Bowl." 
Images of a border wall caused the television network to reject the conclusion of the commercial, but 84 Lumber decided to release the full film online as to not distort the original message. 
"Even President Trump has said there should be a 'big beautiful door in the wall so that people can come into this country legally,'" said 84 Lumber president and owner, Maggie Hardy Magerko. "It's not about the wall. It's about the door in the wall. If people are willing to work hard and make this country better, that door should be open to them." 
The full film can be viewed here.
